notes.text:
An update for webkit2gtk3 is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.4 Advanced Mission Critical Update Support, Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.4 Telecommunications Update Service, and Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.4 Update Services for SAP Solutions.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
WebKitGTK is the port of the portable web rendering engine WebKit to the GTK platform.

Security Fix(es):

* webkitgtk: Memory corruption issue when processing web content (CVE-2022-32885)

* webkitgtk: arbitrary javascript code execution (CVE-2023-40397)

* webkitgtk: Arbitrary Remote Code Execution (CVE-2023-42917)

* webkitgtk: type confusion may lead to arbitrary code execution (CVE-2024-23222)

* webkitgtk: Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution (CVE-2023-42852)

* chromium-browser: Use after free in ANGLE (CVE-2024-4558)

* webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Use after free may lead to Remote Code Execution (CVE-2024-40776)

* webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to an unexpected process crash (CVE-2024-40789)

* webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved bounds checking (CVE-2024-40780)

* webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved bounds checking (CVE-2024-40779)

* webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Use-after-free was addressed with improved memory management (CVE-2024-40782)

* webkitgtk: Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution (CVE-2024-27808)

* webkitgtk: Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution (CVE-2024-27820)

* webkitgtk: Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution (CVE-2024-27833)

* webkitgtk: Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution (CVE-2024-27851)

* webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to an unexpected process crash (CVE-2024-44185)

* webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to an unexpected process crash (CVE-2024-44244)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in WebKitGTK. This security issue occurs when processing maliciously crafted web content that may lead to arbitrary code execution. This memory corruption issue was addressed with improved validation.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: webkitgtk: Memory corruption issue when processing web content
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This flaw is being rated as 'Moderate' as WebKitGTK package is shipped as a dependency for Gnome package, additionally Red Hat Enterprise Linux doesn't ship any WebKitGTK based web browser where this flaw would present a higher severity major threat.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options don't meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

vulnerabilities.title: webkitgtk: Memory corruption issue when processing web content

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Directives in Statically Saved Code ('Static Code Injection')

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in WebKit. This flaw allows a remote attacker to cause arbitrary javascript code execution.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: webkitgtk: arbitrary javascript code execution
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This flaw is being rated as 'Moderate' as WebKitGTK package is shipped as a dependency for Gnome package. Additionally, Red Hat Enterprise Linux doesn't ship any WebKitGTK based web browser where this flaw would present a higher severity major threat.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options don't meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

notes.text: A logic issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.1 and iPadOS 17.1, watchOS 10.1, iOS 16.7.2 and iPadOS 16.7.2, macOS Sonoma 14.1, Safari 17.1, tvOS 17.1. Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: webkitgtk: Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This vulnerability is rated important because it affects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability (CIA) of systems, with a high severity rating.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: webkitgtk: Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution

notes.text: A flaw was found in WebKitGTK. Processing malicious web content may lead to remote code execution. This vulnerability is known to be actively exploited in the wild and was included in the CISA's KEV catalog.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: webkitgtk: Arbitrary Remote Code Execution
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: All versions of Red Hat Enterprise Linux are affected to this vulnerability. To exploit this flaw, an attacker needs to trick a user into processing or loading malicious web content. For this reason, this flaw was rated with an important, and not critical, severity.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
Do not process or load untrusted web content. Please update the affected package as soon as possible.

notes.text: Use after free in ANGLE in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.155 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: chromium-browser: Use after free in ANGLE
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: chromium-browser: Use after free in ANGLE

cwe.name: Access of Resource Using Incompatible Type ('Type Confusion')

notes.text: A flaw was found in WebKitGTK. Processing malicious web content may lead to remote code execution due to a type confusion issue. This vulnerability is known to be actively exploited in the wild and was included in the CISA's KEV catalog.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: webkitgtk: type confusion may lead to arbitrary code execution
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
This flaw depends on the WebKitGTK JIT engine to be enabled. This feature has been disabled in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.8 and 9.2 by the errata RHSA-2023:4202 and RHSA-2023:4201. Therefore, Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.8 and 9.2, when these errata are applied, and newer versions are not affected by this vulnerability.

RHSA-2023:4202: https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2023:4202
RHSA-2023:4201: https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2023:4201

To exploit this flaw, an attacker needs to trick a user into processing or loading malicious web content. For this reason, this flaw was rated with an important, and not critical, severity.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
Do not process or load untrusted web content. Please update the affected package as soon as possible.

vulnerabilities.title: webkitgtk: type confusion may lead to arbitrary code execution

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in WebKit. This flaw allows a remote attacker to perform arbitrary code execution when processing web content. This flaw is caused by insufficient memory handling, which attackers could exploit to execute malicious code on affected systems.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: webkitgtk: Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This WebKit vulnerability marked as important because it enables remote attackers to execute malicious code on users' systems just by visiting compromised websites, posing significant risks like data theft and system compromise.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options do not meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in WebKitGTK. A use-after-free may lead to Remote Code Execution. Users are advised to avoid processing untrusted web content in WebKitGTK.

notes.text: webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Use after free may lead to Remote Code Execution

vulnerabilities.title: webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Use after free may lead to Remote Code Execution

notes.text: A flaw was found in WebKitGTK. Processing malicious web content can trigger an out-of-bounds read due to improper bounds checking, causing an unexpected process crash, resulting in a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved bounds checking
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: To exploit this flaw, an attacker needs to trick a user into processing or loading malicious web content.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
Do not process or load untrusted web content with WebKitGTK.

notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Use-after-free was addressed with improved memory management
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: To exploit this flaw, an attacker needs to trick a user into processing or loading malicious web content.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
Do not process or load untrusted web content with WebKitGTK.

vulnerabilities.title: webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Use-after-free was addressed with improved memory management

notes.text: A flaw was found in WebKitGTK. Processing malicious web content can trigger an out-of-bounds read due to improper bounds checking, causing an unexpected process crash, resulting in a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to an unexpected process crash
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: To exploit this flaw, an attacker needs to trick a user into processing or loading malicious web content.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
Do not process or load untrusted web content with WebKitGTK.

vulnerabilities.title: webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to an unexpected process crash

cwe.name: Access of Memory Location After End of Buffer

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in WebKitGTK, where processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to the program crashing. Code execution is not discarded as a consequence.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to an unexpected process crash
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This vulnerability is rated as important severity because it allows maliciously crafted web content to crash the application, potentially leads to denial of service. While it does not compromise confidentiality or integrity, the ability to crash the program without requiring authentication poses a significant risk.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options do not meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.
